alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Lake Wind Advisory issued May 26 at 2:01PM PDT until May 27 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...LAKE WIND ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING... ...LAKE WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 11 PM PDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...For Today: Southwest winds 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. For Friday: West winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph expected. For Lake Tahoe specifically, waves of 1 to 3 feet today and 2 to 4 feet Friday. * WHERE...Walker, Greater Lake Tahoe Area, Frenchman, Stampede, Davis, and Eagle and Tahoe, Donner, Fallen Leaf, Prosser and Boca. * WHEN...For the first Lake Wind Advisory, until 11 PM PDT this evening. For the second Lake Wind Advisory, from 11 AM to 11 PM PDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Small boats, kayaks and paddle boards will be prone to capsizing and should remain off lake waters until conditions improve.
info.instruction: Check lake conditions before heading out and be prepared for a sudden increase in winds and wave heights. Consider postponing boating activities on the lake until a day with less wind.

area.areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties
